results.title: It came to stay
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the motor industry in Australia from approximately 1904 and shows the significant changes that have taken place in this field. The film shows the production of motor cars from molten metal to finished product.

results.title: Island target
results.creator_credit: Ralph Smart and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The story of one squadron of Australian airmen in action against the Japanese in the islands north of Australia. The work of the squadron included the covering of Allied landings and a hazardous attack on Japanese headquarteres on one particular island.

results.title: Island of dreams: a fable for our time
results.brief_description: An animated film showing a man going through the rat race called “earning a living” and fighting both people and traffic. At home there is no escape from noise and distraction; he dreams of an island paradise which in the end reveals its own problems.

results.title: Island observed
results.creator_credit: Hector Lemieux, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film record of M.E.T.E.I. (Medical Expedition to Easter Island), one of the most unusual scientific enquiries ever launched, headed by a McGill University research team. While the film is concerned mainly with the physical condition of Easter Islanders, it also provides glimpses of island activities, a village wedding, and the famous long-faced stone sculptures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hector Lemieux, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Is the Governor necessary?
results.brief_description: An investigation of the history and functions of the office of the Governor-General. Compares this with other Commonwealth countries, and with the roles of the state governors.

results.title: Invitation to social psychology (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Harry From, Stanley Milgram and Harper & Row
results.brief_description: This film introduces the student to the subject by focusing on the subject matter of social psychology, it’s methods of investigation and some of the basic findings. The film looks at a bustling student cafeteria to show how the discipline uses scientific scrutiny. Examines issues such as affiliation, cognitive dissonance, conformity and aggression.

results.title: Investigation of some hand motions
results.brief_description: An analysis of the following: 1. The time required to grasp machine screws from various types of bins. 2. The time required to position pins in bushings with bevelled holes. 3. The time required to position small blocks. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: Introduction to chemistry
results.brief_description: Begins by defining the science of chemistry and then shows how it is studied and demonstrates its industrial applications. Examples of the way in which our daily lives are affected by the work of chemists are then shown.

results.title: Atlantic community: introducing Portugal
results.creator_credit: Europa Telefilm and North Atlantic Treaty Organization
results.brief_description: Describes the country and the people of Portugal - geographical features, historical development and achievements, economic life, occupations of the people, and social customs. Explains briefly the role of Portugal in the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation. Narrated by Robert Beatty.
